Legal_Issue: Whether Lori Gollan and Myron Paskemin are disqualified from the Tribunal due to bias or appointment irregularities
Application_Facts: Gollan had a solicitor-client relationship with Chief Atcheynum and potential financial interest in election outcomes; Paskemin's appointment was within regulations
Decision_Outcome: Gollan is disqualified due to apprehended bias; Paskemin remains on the Tribunal
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Tribunal member appointments
Court_Ruling: Gollan removed, Paskemin stays, new Tribunal Chair to be selected by Band Council
Defendant_Behavior: Sweetgrass First Nation challenged the appointments of Gollan and Paskemin
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged bias of Gollan, procedural fairness concerns, and appointment irregularities
Legal_Standard: No reasonable apprehension of bias, procedural fairness, unbiased tribunal
Assessment_Factor: Nature of relationship between Gollan and Chief Atcheynum, financial interest, compliance with appointment regulations
Procedural_Issue: Appointment of Tribunal members, judicial review process
Review_Standard: Reasonable apprehension of bias, compliance with legal and procedural requirements
Evidence_Used: Evidence of solicitor-client relationship, financial interest, regulatory compliance documentation
Application_Basis: Analysis of legal principles and evidence presented in judicial review
Evidence_Assessed: Solicitor-client relationship, financial interest, appointment records
Relief_Sought: Disqualification of Gollan and Paskemin from the Tribunal
Governing_Rule: Principles of natural justice, Federal Courts Act
Outcome: Gollan disqualified, Paskemin retained, new Chair to be appointed by Band Council
Decisional_Body: Tribunal reviewing Sweetgrass First Nation election results
Harm_Assessment: Potential unfairness in election dispute resolution due to biased member
Cause_Description: Dispute over Sweetgrass First Nation election results and Tribunal member appointments
Evidence_Handling: Evaluation of relationship and interest evidence for bias assessment
Legal_Provision_Violated: None found regarding Paskemin; apprehended bias concerning Gollan under principles of natural justice
Legal_Provision: Federal Courts Act, principles of natural justice
Evidence_Assessment: Relevant evidence considered on bias and appointment legality
Decision_Rationale: Gollan's relationship creates reasonable apprehension of bias; Paskemin's appointment complies with regulations
Legal_Standard_Applied: No reasonable apprehension of bias, procedural fairness
